posts.content_clean: Cambridge IELTS 14 Listening Test 4 Answers SECTION 1 1. Answer : 85 HereтАЩs what the speakers say: ANDREW тАУ Will you be having a sit-down meal or a buffet? SAM тАУ Probably a sit-down. ANDREW тАУ And do you know how many people thereтАЩll be? SAMтАУ Around eighty, I think. ANDREW тАУ Well we have two rooms that can hold that number. One is the Adelphi Room. That can seat eighty-five, or hold over a hundred if people are standing for a buffet. Explanation: The customer is asking about holding an event at the hotel, and we can tell that they are talking about the rooms for the events, which is the answer for Question 1, so we should focus here. According to Andrew, they have two rooms suitable for the request, one of them is the Adelphi Room, which can seat 85 (= it has enough seats for 85 people), or more than a hundred if it is a standing buffet. However, the customer requires a sit-down meal, so the answer is 85. 2. Answer: roses HereтАЩs what the speaker says: ANDREW тАУ [тАж] Now the Adelphi Room is at the back of the hotel, and there are French windows leading out onto the terrace. This has a beautiful display of pots of roses at that time of the year. Explanation: After Question 1, Andrew continues to talk a bit about the services of the Adelphi Room. Candidates need to be careful not to lose their concentration. Andrew mentions the room is тАЬat the back of the hotelтАЭ, and the guests can see from the French windows тАЬleading outтАЭ to the тАЬpots of rosesтАЭ on the terrace. Roses is the answer for Question 2. 3. Answer: trees HereтАЩs what the speaker says: ANDREW тАУ From the terrace you can see the area of trees within the grounds of the hotel, or you can stroll through there to the river тАУ thatтАЩs on the far side, so it isnтАЩt visible from the hotel. Explanation: As Question 3 is also in the part of the тАЬAdelphi RoomтАЭ, the answer will not be far away from the answer for Question 2. Right after finishing talking about the direction of the room, Andrew continues to describe the view from the terrace. Andrew says that the trees тАШwithin the groundsтАЩ can be seen тАШfrom the terraceтАЩ. He also mentions the river, but itтАЩs тАШon the far sideтАЩ, so itтАЩs not тАШvisibleтАЩ тАУ cannot be seen тАУ from the hotel, or the terrace. So the answer is trees. 4. Answer: Stage HereтАЩs what the speaker says: ANDREW тАУ Then another option is the Carlton Room. This is a bit bigger тАФ it can hold up to a hundred and ten people тАФ and it has the advantage of a stage, which is useful if you have any entertainment, or indeed a small band can fit onto it. Explanation: Moving on the second room, the Carlton Room, is one of the choices for the event, and by the mention of the name, we know that we are getting closer to the answer to Question 4. The blank clearly needs a noun, and from what Andrew says, we learn that the room has a stage. Answer: stage 5. Answer: speech HereтАЩs what the speakers say: ANDREW тАУ As well as a meal, you can have an MC, a Master of Ceremonies, whoтАЩll be with you throughout the party. SAM тАУ What exactly is the MCтАЩs function? I suppose they make a speech during the meal if we need one, do they? ANDREW тАУ ThatтАЩs right. All our MCs are trained as public speakers, so they can easily get peopleтАЩs attention тАУ many guests are glad to have someone who can make themselves heard above the chatter! Explanation: We know that the answer will be found in the Master of Ceremonies section. тАШMake a speechтАЩ and тАШgive a speechтАЩ have the same meaning. The guest asks if the MC can тАШmake a speechтАЩ during the meal, which means while they are eating. Andrew confirms that the MC can make a speech, so the answer for Question 5 is тАШspeechтАЩ. Answer: speech 6. Answer: support HereтАЩs what the speaker says: ANDREW тАУ And theyтАЩre also your support тАУ if anything goes wrong, the MC will deal with it, so you can relax. Explanation: The words тАШanything goes wrongтАЩ relates to having тАШproblemsтАЩ, and the MC will тАШdeal with itтАЩ, which is identical to тАШprovide supportтАЩ. So the answer is support. Answer: support 7. Answer: cabins HereтАЩs what the speakers say: SAM тАУ Great! IтАЩll need to ask you about food, but something else thatтАЩs important is accommodation. You obviously have rooms in the hotel, but do you also have any other accommodation, like cabins, for example? ANDREW тАУ Yes, there are five in the grounds, all self-contained. They each sleep two to four people and have their own living room, bathroom and small kitchen. Explanation: The man mentions тАЬaccommodationтАЭ so we can expect the answer for Question 7 will come next, and we find the word тАЬcabinтАЭ appears in the conversation. The following answer also continues to describe the facilities of the cabins, so cabins is the right answer. Answer: cabins 8. Answer: C HereтАЩs what the speakers say: SAM тАУ Now you have various facilities, donтАЩt you? Are they all included in the price of hiring the room? The pool, for instance. ANDREW тАУ Normally youтАЩd be able to use it, but itтАЩll be closed throughout September for refurbishment, IтАЩm afraid. Explanation: The customer asks about other facilities and asks if the access to the pool is included in the price of hiring the room, but there is no information on the extra cost. The pool will be тАШclosedтАЩ for тАШrefurbishmentтАЩ during September, so it is not available right now. Therefore, the answer is C. Answer: C 9. Answer: A HereтАЩs what the speaker says: ANDREW тАУ The gym will be available, though, at no extra charge. ThatтАЩs open all day, from six in the morning until midnight. Explanation: The answer for Question 9 comes right after the answer for Question 8. ThatтАЩs why candidates need to spend time to look at questions beforelistening and get a gist of what kind of information they need for each question, so they know where to focus on. The gym will be at тАШno extra chargeтАЩ, which means it is included in the cost of hiring the room, so the Answer is A. Answer A. 10. Answer: B HereтАЩs what the speaker says: ANDREW тАУ And the tennis courts, but there is a small additional payment for those. We have four courts, and itтАЩs worth booking in advance if you possibly can, as there can be quite a long waiting list for them. Explanation: There is a тАШsmall additional paymentтАЩ for the tennis court, so if you want to use them, you have to pay an extra charge. The tennis courts can be booked in advance and thereтАЩs often тАШa long waiting listтАЩ, so they are not available right now. The answer is B. Answer: B SECTION 2 11. Answer: G HereтАЩs what the speaker says: One thing you have to do while youтАЩre here is go dolphin watching. On our boat trips, we pretty well guarantee youтАЩll see dolphins тАУ if you donтАЩt you can repeat the trip free of charge. We organise daily trips for just 35 euros. Unfortunately, there arenтАЩt any places left for this afternoonтАЩs trip, but come and see me to book for later in the week. Explanation: According to the speaker, the guests can тАШrepeat the trip free of chargeтАЩ but only if they do not see dolphins, so it cannot be considered as no charge. The organisers of the тАШdaily tripsтАЩ do not have тАШany places left for this afternoonтАЩs tripтАЩ and the guests are advised to тАШbook for later in the weekтАЩ, which means today is already fully-booked. G is the answer. Answer: G 12. Answer: D HereтАЩs what the speaker says: lf you re energetic, IтАЩd recommend our forest walk. ItтАЩs a guided walk of about seven kilometres. ThereтАЩll be a stop half way, and youтАЩll be provided with a drink and sandwiches. Explanation: In this kind of question, speakers will quickly talk about each part, which is each question, so candidates need to know the choices very well to know what options they have. The words тАШprovided with a drink and sandwichesтАЩ means food is included. No information is given on the other options, so the answer is D. Answer: D 13. Answer: A HereтАЩs what the speaker says: Then on Thursdays we organise a cycle trip, which will give you all the fun of biking without the effort. WeтАЩll take you and your bike up to the top of Mount Larna, and leave you to bike back тАУ itтАЩs a 700-metre drop in just 20 kilometres so this isnтАЩt really for inexperienced cyclists as youтАЩll be going pretty fast. And if itтАЩs a clear day, youтАЩll have fantastic views. Explanation: The trip тАШisnтАЩt really for inexperienced cyclistsтАЩ implies that it is not suitable for beginners. There will be fantastic views on a clear day, but this doesnтАЩt mean we can only go in good weather. ItтАЩs a тАШ700-metre dropтАЩ in 20km from the top of the mountain, which means going/downhill, so the answer is A. Answer: A. 14. Answer: E HereтАЩs what the speaker says: On our local craft tour, you can find out about the traditional activities in the island. And the best thing about this trip is that itтАЩs completely free. YouтАЩll be taken to a factory where jewellery is made, and also a ceramics centre. lf you want, you can buy some of the products, but thatтАЩs entirely up to you. Explanation: It is clearly stated at the beginning of the sentence that he is talking about the craft tour, so we should focus here to find the answer for Question 14. The trip consists of visits to see traditional activities and you are free to buy products if you wish. Especially, the trip is тАЬcompletely freeтАЭ, which means there will be no charge, so the answer is E. Answer: E 15. Answer: F HereтАЩs what the speaker says: lf youтАЩre interested in astronomy you may already know that the islandтАЩs one of the best places in the world to observe the night sky. We can offer trips to the observatory on Friday for those who are interested. They cost 90 euros per person and youтАЩll be shown the huge telescopes and have a talk from an expert, whoтАЩll explain all about how they work. Afterwards, weтАЩll head down to Sunset Beach, where you can have a dip in the ocean if you want before we head off back to the hotel. Explanation: After Question 14, the speaker continues to talk a lot about the following trips, but has not mentioned any related information. Candidates need to be careful not to lose their concentration. Finally he mentions that at the end of the trip, the guests will go to Sunset Beach to have a тАШdip in the oceanтАЩ, which means it will be possible to swim in the ocean before heading back. The answer is F. Answer: F 16. Answer: B HereтАЩs what the speaker says: Finally, thereтАЩs horse riding. This is organised by the Equestrian Centre over near Playa Cortino and itтАЩs a great experience if youтАЩre a keen horseback rider, or even if youтАЩve never been on a horse before. Explanation: The trip is a тАШgreat experienceтАЩ not only for a keen horseback rider, but also for people who тАШhave never been on a horse beforeтАЩ, so itтАЩs suitable even for beginners. B is the answer. Answer: B 17-18. Answer: B. You must book it in advance. D. You can meet the performers. HereтАЩs what the speaker says: Well, the number one attractionтАЩs called тАШMusical FavouritesтАЩ. Guests enjoy a three-course meal and unlimited free drinks, and watch a fantastic show, starting with musicals set in Paris and then crossing the Atlantic to Las Vegas and finally Copacabana. At the end the cast members come down from the stage, still in their stunning costumes, and youтАЩll have a chance to chat with them. ItтАЩs hugely popular, so let me know now if youтАЩre interested because itтАЩs no good leaving it until the last minute. ItтАЩs on Friday night. Tickets are just 90 euros each, but for an extra 10 euros you can have a table right by the stage. Explanation: With this kind of question, make sure that you understand all the choices you have before listening as the speaker will paraphrase it and say it in a different way, and the number of choices may confuse you if you do not know them well. The speaker is talking about an attraction called тАШMusical FavouritesтАЩ, where you can enjoy meals and drink while enjoying a fantastic show. The guests can тАЬhave a chance to chatтАЭ and meet the performers at the end of the show (answer D). As it is very popular, itтАЩs тАЬno good leaving it until the last minuteтАЭ, which means you have to book early (answer B). ThereтАЩs no information on whether you have to pay extra for the drink (answer A), getting discount on purchasing two tickets (answer C) or joining in the show (answer E). So the answers are B and D Answers: B, D (in either order) 19-20. Answer: A Visitors can dance after the meal., D Knives and forks are not used. HereтАЩs what the speaker says: lf youтАЩd like to go back in time, thereтАЩs the Castle Feast on Saturday evening. ItтАЩs held in a twelfth-century castle, and you eat in the great courtyard, with ladies in long gowns serving your food. You re given a whole chicken each, which you eat in the medieval way, using your hands instead of cutlery, and you re entertained by competitions where the horseback riders attempt to knock one another off their horses. Then you can watch the dancers in the ballroom and join in as well if you want. Explanation: The speaker may say some words used in the answers, but in a different context to make candidates confused. So, be careful, especially because in IELTS Listening it is common that the examiners will paraphrase the words you hear in the script. The speaker describes Castle Feast, an event held in an ancient castle. You are given a тАЬwhole chickenтАЭ, which means you cannot choose the type of food (answer B). You have to eat by hand without knives and forks (answer D) while being entertained by horseback riders knocking each other off their horses. So, this is NOT horse racing (answer E). ThereтАЩs no rule about dress code for the guests (answer C), but they can join in the dancing in the ballroom (answer A). So, the answers are A and D, Answers: A, D (in either order). SECTION 3 21. Answer: A. the fact that authors may not realise what values theyтАЩre teaching HereтАЩs what the speaker says: TREVOR тАУ And whether the teaching should be factual тАУ giving them information about the world тАУ or ethical, teaching them values. WhatтАЩs fascinating is that the writer isnтАЩt necessarily conscious of the message theyтАЩre conveying. For instance, a story might show a child who has a problem as a result of not doing what an adult has told them to do, implying that children should always obey adults. Explanation: Trevor mentions that literature can be factual or ethical, so we can exclude answer B. ThereтАЩs no information on the fact that children are expected to act like fictional characters, so C is not the answer He finds that the writers are not тАЬnecessarily consciousтАЭ of what they are delivering, which means they may not recognise their own values. So the answer is A Answer: A 22. Answer: C. decide to start writing some childrenтАЩs stories. HereтАЩs what the speaker says: TREVOR тАУ That module made me realise how important stories are тАУ they can have a significant effect on children as they grow up. Actually, it inspired me to have a go at it myself, just for my own interest. l know l canтАЩt compete with the really popular stories, like the Harry Potter books тАУ theyтАЩre very good, and even young kids like my seven-year-old niece love reading them. Explanation: Thanks to the module, Trevor realised the important effect of childrenтАЩs stories on children, which motivates him to тАЬhave a goтАЭ at creating his own childrenтАЩs stories (answer C). He wants to write them for his own satisfaction, not to compete with popular stories that young kids read, because those popular stories are very good тАУ so answer B is incorrect. The module only made him aware of the importance of stories, but did not motivate him to analyse childrenтАЩs stories, so A is also incorrect. The answer is C. Answer: C 23. Answer: A. she intends to become an illustrator. HereтАЩs what the speaker says: STEPHANIE тАУ I remember some frightening ones I saw as a child and I can still see them vividly in my mind, years later! Pictures can be so powerful, just as powerful as words. IтАЩve always enjoyed drawing, so thatтАЩs the field I want to go into when I finish the course. Explanation: The impact of visual images has influenced Stephanie since she was young, when she happened to see some frightening (not beautiful) images (thus we can exclude answer B). Pictures and words have the same power тАУ therefore illustration are not more important than words (answer C is incorrect). She wants to work in the illustration field as she really enjoys drawing. So the answer is A. Answer: A 24. Answer: B. have the potential for being useful. HereтАЩs what the speakers say: TREVOR тАУ We also studied comics in that module, but IтАЩm not convinced of their value, not compared with books. One of the great things about words is that you use your imagination, but with a comic you donтАЩt have to. STEPHANIE тАУ But children are so used to visual input тАУ on TV, video games, and so on. There are plenty of kids who wouldnтАЩt even try to read a book, so I think comics can serve a really useful purpose. TREVOR тАУ You mean, itтАЩs better to read a comic than not to read at all? posts.content_clean: SECTION 1 1. Answer: Tesla HereтАЩs what the speakers say: MAN тАУ OK. Now can you tell me a bit about what conference facilities you have? ANGELA тАУ Sure. Answer: Wifi 5. Answer: 45 HereтАЩs what the speakers say: ANGELA тАУ Would you also like us to provide a buffet lunch? We can do a two-course meal with a number of different options. Explanation: Candidates should get used to some currency names, symbols and codes, for example, the official currency of the US is dollar (symbol: $, ISO code: USD) so they do not get confused in some situations like this. There is extra information on the additional of $25 for the special lunch, this is information added to cause distraction and confusion. Answer: 135 HereтАЩs what the speakers say: MAN тАУ Now weтАЩre also going to need accommodation on the Saturday night for some of the participantsтАжIтАЩm not sure how many, but probably about 25. Answer: A decorating, E childcare HereтАЩs what the speaker says: Volunteers can do all sorts of things, depending on their own abilities and interests. lf theyтАЩre supporting a family thatтАЩs struggling, for example, they may be able to give them tips on cooking, or recommend how to plan their budget or how to shop sensibly on their income. Explanation: With this kind of question, make sure that you understand all the choices you have before listening, as the speaker will paraphrase it and say it in a different way. Answer: D improved ability at time management E boosting their employment prospects HereтАЩs what the speaker says: The benefit from volunteering isnтАЩt only for the people being helped. One of the benefits is that volunteers have the chance to use their skills to тАЬcope with somebodyтАЩs mental or physical ill healthтАЭ, add тАЬa valuable elementтАЭ to their CV because employers are more likely to offer a job to people who have done voluntary work (answer E). Volunteering also тАЬgives them a purpose in their livesтАЭ (answer B). There is no information about working in a team (answer A), realisation that they are lucky to be doing voluntary work (answer C) or management skills (answer D). Anwesr: B, E (in either order). 15. Answer: F HereтАЩs what the speaker says: Habib supports an elderly lady who is beginning to show signs of dementia. Answer: A HereтАЩs what the speaker says: Our volunteer Consuela is an amazing woman. She has difficulty walking herself, but she doesnтАЩt let that stop her. Answer: G HereтАЩs what the speaker says: Tanya visits an elderly woman once a week. When the woman found out that Tanya is a professional dressmaker, she got interested. All of the words are describing how enjoyable it is for the elderly lady to do what she likes, which implies that she has found a new hobby. Answer: G 19. Answer: D HereтАЩs what the speaker says: Alexei is a volunteer with a family that faces a number of difficulties. By calmly talking over possible solutions with family members, heтАЩs helping them to realise that they arenтАЩt helpless, and that they can do something themselves to improve their situation. Answer: D 20. Answer: C HereтАЩs what the speaker says: And the last volunteer IтАЩll mention, though there are plenty more, is Juba. Answer: 50 HereтАЩs what the speaker says: JOE тАУ Well the band has students in it from all years, so theyтАЩre aged 11 to 18, and there are about 50 of them altogether. Answer: 50/fifty 22. Answer: regional HereтАЩs what the speaker says: JOE тАУ They arenтАЩt really good enough to enter national band competitions, but theyтАЩre in a regional one later in the term. Answer: drummer 25. Answer: Film HereтАЩs what the speakers says: JOE тАУ IтАЩm planning to show them that old film from the 1940s тАЬStrike Up the BandтАЭ, and talk about it with the students. Answer: parade HereтАЩs what the speaker says: тАУ IтАЩm hoping I can take some of the band to a parade thatтАЩs going to take place next month. Answer: C Relevance to the present day HereтАЩs what the speaker says: TUTOR: In the last section, relevance to the present day, youтАЩve got some good ideas but this is where you need to move away from the ideas of others and give your own viewpoint. Answer: dances many cultures invented тАж and other ceremonies to make the weather god friendly HereтАЩs what the speaker says: Many ancient civilisations developed rites such as dances in order to make the weather gods look kindly on them. Answer: survival people needed to observe and interpret the sky to ensure their тАж HereтАЩs what the speaker says: But the weather was of daily importance: observing the skies and drawing the correct conclusions these observations was really important, in fact their survival depended on it. Answer: clouds Around 650 BC, Babylonians started forecasting, using weather phenomena such as тАж HereтАЩs what the speaker says: It isnтАЩt known when the people first started to observe the skies, but around 650 BC, the Babylonians produced the first short-range weather forecasts, based on their observations of cloudsand other phenomena. Answer: festivals By 300 BC, the Chinese had a calendar made up of a number ofтАжтАжтАжтАж. connected with the weather. Answer: comets Aristotle also described haloes and тАж HereтАЩs what the speaker says: He also described celestial phenomena such as haloes тАУ that is, bright circles of light around the sun, the moon and bright stars тАУ and comets. Answer: sky many proverbs, e.g about the significant colour of the тАж , passed on accurate information. HereтАЩs what the speaker says: Alongside this, though, in the Middle Ages weather observations were passed on in the form of proverbs, such as тАШRed sky at night, shepherdтАЩs delight; red sky in the morning, shepherdтАЩs warningтАЩ. Answer: storms 18th century: Franklin identified the movement of тАж HereтАЩs what the speaker says: It was Franklin who discovered that storms generally travel from west to east. Answer: telegraph 19th century: data from different locations could be sent to the same place by тАж HereтАЩs what the speaker says: People in different locations began to keep records, and in the mid-nineteenth century, the invention of the telegraph made it possible for these records to be collated. posts.title: Cambridge IELTS 14 Listening Test 1 Answers
posts.content_clean: SECTION 1 1. Answer: Canadian Nationality HereтАЩs what the speakers say: OFFICER: Ok, thank you. And are you resident in the UK? Louise also mentions her mom being British. This is a trick and candidates need to be careful: there will be more than one piece of information that can potentially be the answer. Answer: Canadian 2. Answer: furniture Reason for visit: business (to buy antique тАж) HereтАЩs what the speakers say: OFFICER: So youтАЩre just visiting the country? LOUISE: ThatтАЩs right. I come over most summers on business. IтАЩm an interior designer and I come over to buy old furniture, antiques you know. As the word needed is behind the adjective тАЬantiqueтАЭ, it should be a noun, referring to something rare and old. The answer is тАЬfurnitureтАЭ. Answer: furniture 3. Answer: Park Current Address: тАж Apartments (No 15) HereтАЩs what the speakers say: OFFICER: So may I ask where you are staying now? Explanation: We need to listen to the questions from the officer as these questions will let us know what information will come up next. This question is about where Louise is staying now, so itтАЩs about her current address. Candidates need to be aware that it is тАЬcurrentтАЭ address, which means where she is staying at present, not in the past. Therefore, the answer is Park. Candidates should note down information that they can hear in the first place, after that, when the speaker explains further, candidates can compare the information they had with the new information to see which particular piece of information is needed.
